thread.title: A Day Without A Woman Strike Is Coming - Future Women's March
thread.title_full: A Day Without A Woman Strike Is Coming - Future Women's March

author: Emma Dibdin
title: A Day Without A Woman Strike Is Coming - Future Women's March
text:
The Women's March Organizers Are Planning a Women's Strike 
"A Day Without a Woman" already has a groundswell of support online. Most Popular By Emma Dibdin Feb 6, 2017 The organizers of the Women's March today unveiled their next major event—a "general strike" for women. Though the Instagram announcement is vague, the title "A Day Without A Woman" makes it clear that this is a unique kind of strike, representing not employees of a company or members of a union, but an entire gender. A photo posted by Women's March (@womensmarch) on Feb 6, 2017 at 8:03am PST Advertisement - Continue Reading Below "The will of the people will stand," reads the caption. And though information is thin on the ground, the groundswell of support that has already emerged speaks volumes—four hours after it was posted on Monday, the Instagram post already had close to 20,000 likes. This is the latest of many strikes to arise in the wake of Donald Trump's inauguration, and his administration's botched rollout of its controversial immigration ban. On Inauguration Day, more than 7,000 women participated in a strike , organized by the feminist group National Women's Liberation. Another organization is calling for a national general strike on February 17, in defense of the constitution and in protest of Trump's policies. Most Popular "This is what I'm talking about. Hit 'em in the wallet," wrote comedian Corinne Fisher on Twitter , echoing the sentiment of the #GrabYourWallet boycott campaign which scored a major victory last week. After months of boycotts from consumers, Nordstrom dropped Ivanka Trump's clothing line from its stores, with Neiman Marcus swiftly following suit. Protest works.
